content.webTitle: Six Nations 2013: Wales's Warburton is back; Brian O'Driscoll farewell?

fields.headline: Six Nations 2013: Wales's Warburton is back but what about O'Driscoll?
fields.bodyText: MAN OF THE DAY Wales's Sam Warburton. Good to see him back where he belongs – and clear proof that class is permanent. SCENE-SETTING OF THE DAY At the top of the BBC programme, John Inverdale welcomed us to a "grey, dreary, very cold, blowy, gusty, wet Saturday afternoon" at Murrayfield. The quality of rugby duly followed suit. MOST POIGNANT SIGHT Brian O'Driscoll disappearing down the Dublin tunnel. Was it for the final time? Looking on: his emotional wife, Amy, and their one-month-old daughter, Sadie. FRANCE WOE WATCH It's now seven, yes seven, games without a Six Nations win – that's five defeats and two draws (both with Ireland, oddly). Zut alors. UNLIKELIEST NEWS The Twickenham pitch on Sunday includes 400 blades of grass on which a rice writer has spent 30 hours writing the names of English rugby clubs. It's in a good cause, though, promoting RBS's grassroots programme.
